title: Will Trump’s latest Gaza plan succeed when everything else has failed?
Morning Digest: Hamas ready to free hostages but wants further negotiation on Trump’s Gaza plan; Centre says cough syrups not contaminated but T.N. detects adulteration, and more
description: Here is a select list of stories to start the day

title: Express View on ‘I love Muhammad’ row: UP government’s crackdown erodes ‘vishwas’
Ahead of Pak game, snake scare headlines India training session
description: During their training session at R Premadasa Stadium on Friday, the Indian women's cricket team encountered a non-venomous common rat snake. This familiar reptile, often seen at the venue, moved along drains, creating a light-hearted moment for players and staff. India is preparing for their World Cup match against Pakistan.

title: Lawsuit seeks to stop Trump’s $100,000 fee for H-1B visas
description: Lawsuit filed against Trump’s $100,000 H-1B visa fee, claiming chaos for employers, workers, and federal agencies

title: Highways Dept. to put back Annadurai’s statue amid AIADMK’s protest in Tiruvannamalai
US government shutdown extended after Senate votes fail again
description: The US government shutdown entered its third day with no resolution as Republican and Democratic leaders remain deadlocked. Republicans insist on their short-term funding bill, while Democrats refuse without their input, citing public opinion blaming the GOP. Both parties' bills have failed, and the GOP needs five more Democratic votes to advance their proposal.

title: Asia Cup drama: 'What Naqvi is doing is absolutely right' - PCB chief gets backing
description: Former Pakistan cricketer Mohammad Yousuf has publicly supported ACC chief Mohsin Naqvi amidst the Asia Cup trophy controversy. India, after winning the 2025 final, declined to receive the trophy from Naqvi, prompting BCCI to demand his removal. Yousuf criticized India's refusal as 'filmy,' asserting they should have accepted it as per rules, underscoring escalating tensions between the cricket boards.

title: Two million people rally in Italy for Gaza as general strike halts key services
description: In Florence, protesters approached the gates of the Italian national soccer team’s training center to demand its upcoming World Cup qualifier against Israel not be played because of the war in Gaza.

title: Cancer Horoscope Today, 04 October 2025: Expressing your emotions openly will deepen your relationship
Gemini Horoscope Today, 04 October 2025: You long for escape from the urban rush
Taurus Horoscope Today, 04 October 2025: Ganesha is happy to tell you that your concentration will remain at its best in the profession
Aries Horoscope Today, 04 October 2025: You may put in a lot of efforts to complete all the pending tasks
Pisces Horoscope Today, 04 October 2025: Lay it wisely. Prosperity begins with precision

Virgo Horoscope Today, 04 October 2025: Work commitments may leave little time for romance
Leo Horoscope Today, 04 October 2025: New business or professional alliances are likely to emerge
Expert says being skinny-fat can be just as risky as being overweight, lists risk factors
Manchester synagogue attack: Police say suspect on bail in rape case- Key points
description: A suspected terror attack outside a Manchester synagogue on Yom Kippur left two Jewish men dead and three injured. Police fatally shot assailant Jihad Al-Shamie, 35, a British national of Syrian descent, who was on bail for rape and possibly influenced by extreme Islamist ideology. Six others were arrested on terror charges.

title: ‘Threatening witness’ charge added in Chaitanyananda FIR
US tariffs have thrown Indian businesses into uncertainty: Amit Mitra
Clean toilet at NDLS: AAP’s Bharadwaj praises Rlys Min
Delhi govt mulls excise policy tweak to bring liquor cost at par with Gurgaon
Resource centres must offer physiotherapy, counselling to children with disabilities at Delhi govt schools
IAS coaching institute fined Rs 5 lakh over misleading ad
UP: Teen ‘loses sight’ after ‘beating’ in police custody, family says human rights panel should step in
Delhi: Man arrested for arranging illegal documents to facilitate foreign travels
The 2025 Ig Nobel prizes: laugh, and then think
description: Each winner receives a single banknote of 10 trillion Zimbabwean dollars and one minute to deliver a talk about their work

title: Government funding vote fails again in Senate as hopes fade for quick end to shutdown
description: Although Republicans control the White House and both chambers of Congress, the Senate's filibuster rules make it necessary for the government funding legislation to gain support from at least 60 of the 100 senators.

title: FIRs lodged over caller impersonating MoHUA secy
Drain to Palwal to address Gurgaon waterlogging: Manohar Lal
In Karur, where there was no way out
description: On September 27, thousands of people gathered in Karur, Tamil Nadu, to attend a rally by actor-turned-politician Vijay. As the chief of the Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam party arrived hours late, the crowd swelled and surged towards his vehicle, triggering a stampede that killed 41 people and injured over 100. C. Jaisankar and Nacchinarkkiniyan M. report on the tragedy, caused by many factors, including poor planning and alleged security lapses

title: Horrific! Stray dogs attack foreign coaches; fifth incident at JLN stadium
description: Stray dog attacks at the World Para Athletics Championships in New Delhi raised serious safety concerns after two foreign coaches and a security guard were bitten on Friday. These incidents, following previous unreported attacks, disrupted the event. Despite efforts to clear the stadium, individuals feeding dogs led to their re-entry, prompting strengthened preventive measures.

title: Air India, AI Express to move some domestic flights to T1 and T2 at Delhi airport
National Medical Commission still to act on junketeering doctors
description: The National Medical Commission (NMC) has yet to act against 30 doctors found guilty of accepting a foreign trip funded by pharma company AbbVie. This delay stems from four out of five vacant posts in its Ethics and Medical Registration Board, hindering action. NMC's new chairperson confirmed the issue, stating a temporary board is being considered to address pending matters.

title: CM to inaugurate Katpadi’s first government hospital
description: The hospital will boast separate sections for cardiology, neurology, paediatrics, nephrology, obstetrics, and gynaecology. It will also have separate wards for emergency and accident cases

title: Two men in Delhi kidnap children to coerce their mothers into relationship, arrested
Accessible rulers
Canada: Khalistan radicals try to set fire to Ontario cinema; twice in a week
description: Pro-Khalistan elements twice attacked an Ontario cinema, attempting arson and firing gunshots, leading the theatre to halt Hindi movie screenings. Designated terror group SFJ subsequently demanded Canada ban all "Made In India" films, alleging they are political weapons for Modi's regime. The theatre CEO confirmed halting Indian films due to safety concerns following these targeted incidents.

title: Who are the 5 top candidates to succeed Ishiba in Japan?
India slams Pakistan over POK unrest: Cites human rights abuses; deaths
description: India strongly condemned Pakistan's "oppressive approach" and human rights abuses amidst violent protests in Pakistan-occupied Kashmir (POK), where eight deaths are confirmed. India reiterated POK's integral status, demanding Pakistan vacate illegally occupied territories. Pakistan's PM expressed concern, dispatching a delegation to address the unrest, which stemmed from failed talks with protesters over resource plundering.

title: Delhi: Rain, winds improve AQI, light rain likely tomorrow
Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs sentenced to more than 4 years in prison over prostitution conviction
'Bangladesh govt has failed minorities', India pulls up Yunus; slams 'blame game'
description: India rejected Bangladesh's allegations that it fueled unrest in Khagrachhari, stating Dhaka's interim government failed to maintain law and order and protect minorities. New Delhi urged Bangladesh to investigate local extremists for violence and land grab in the Chittagong Hill Tracts. This followed clashes over an alleged gang rape, killing three and injuring dozens.

title: Op Sindoor: Downed 12-13 Pak jets, says IAF chief; India also hit F-16s
description: IAF Chief Marshal A P Singh confirmed significant Pakistani losses during Operation Sindoor. He stated 9-10 Pakistani fighters and special aircraft were destroyed. This included F-16s and JF-17s. Satellite imagery showed damage to radar sites and airbases. IAF also shot down a special mission aircraft over 300km away. India ended hostilities after meeting its objectives.

title: 113 idols to be paraded at Immersion Carnival on Oct 5; Kolkata police announce major traffic curbs
Aaditya Thackeray says he started the Mumbai 24/7 initiative in 2020; slams BJP for taking credit
description: Aaditya Thackeray said that the BJP which criticised me on ‘culture and safety’ over my ‘Mumbai 24/7’ policy, has re-issued a GR allowing retailers to stay open

title: BJP govt ended ‘kharchi-parchi’ system prevailing in Haryana earlier: Shah
Now, 12 kids’ deaths linked to cough syrup in MP, Raj; Centre issues advisory
description: Alarm bells are ringing as 12 children in Madhya Pradesh and Rajasthan died following complications from cough syrup use, prompting a central advisory against prescribing such medications to children under two. While the Union health ministry found no contamination in MP samples, the cause of kidney failure remains a mystery. Rajasthan also reported deaths, banning a specific syrup pending investigation.

title: Bengal to face rainy weekend; landslide warning for north
OctaFX case: Illegal trading platform minted Rs 800cr; Indians lost Rs 22k cr
description: The ED is investigating OctaFX, an illegal online trading platform, for laundering thousands of crores from India through transcontinental operations involving cryptocurrencies and international payment gateways. This platform alone generated Rs 800 crore in nine months, with funds layered via fake import services. Indians lost over Rs 22,800 crore in similar financial frauds in 2024.

title: Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs gets four years in prison for case involving sex workers, violence
description: Combs was convicted in July of flying his girlfriends and male sex workers around the country to engage in drug-fueled sexual encounters, a practice that happened over many years and in different locations.

title: Bill-grimage: Rishikesh costliest desi destination; Mumbai top biz spot
description: Rishikesh remains India's priciest hotel destination for the second consecutive year, despite a marginal RevPAR decline. The Indian hospitality sector experienced a robust fiscal year, driven by booming domestic leisure travel and record occupancy rates. Mumbai, Delhi, and Hyderabad emerged as key business hubs, with significant expansion planned across 177 new markets.

title: Want to stay on world map? Stop backing terror: Army chief to Pak
description: Army chief General Upendra Dwivedi sternly warned Pakistan to cease terrorism support or risk its global standing, referencing Operation Sindoor. He revealed over 100 Pakistani soldiers and numerous terrorists were killed, and nine facilities destroyed in precise strikes after the Pahalgam attack. Dwivedi stressed India's future provocations would not go unanswered, urging heightened readiness and modernization among troops.

title: IIAS in Brussels: At multilateral body, India pushes for new global governance index
Mumbai: Six women, a catering unit and a fire that snuffed out their lives, dreams
AIIMS study shows how training gap in certifying brain death hits organ donation
Zubeen's death: Sitting HC judge to head probe panel; ED, I-T dept likely to join
description: Zubeen Garg's death probe escalates to potential murder. Four arrests are made. A judicial commission will form Saturday. ED and I-T may join the financial crime investigation against Shyamkanu Mahanta. Over 60 FIRs are filed across Assam. Zubeen's drummer and co-singer received 14-day custody. The Chief Minister speaks of a coordinated conspiracy.

title: Trump says Hamas ready for peace, tells Israel to stop bombing
description: “Israel must immediately stop the bombing of Gaza, so that we can get the Hostages out safely and quickly!” Mr. Trump posted on Truth Social.

title: Chhattisgarh HC: Dignified cremation part of right to life; orders revamp of sites
description: Chhattisgarh High Court has declared the right to a dignified death and cremation a fundamental right under Article 21. This ruling followed a Chief Justice's visit to a "pathetic" Bilaspur cremation ground. The court mandated the State to provide decent facilities, issuing an 11-point directive for immediate improvements like sanitation, lighting, and functional crematoria, demanding affidavits from top officials.

title: Nagpur hotelier, wife killed in Italy crash: 3 kids critical; govt aids family
description: Nagpur hotelier Javed Akhtar and his wife Nadira tragically died in a road accident in Italy's Tuscany region on Thursday. Their three children, Arzoo, Zezel, and Shifa, sustained life-threatening injuries in the horrific mini-bus collision. Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis is coordinating with the Indian embassy for repatriation and the children's care, as the family's European tour ended in disaster.

title: Jail tyranny: 74% of prisoners are undertrials; systemic delays persist
description: India's prisons are grappling with a staggering 3.9 lakh undertrials, constituting nearly three-fourths of all inmates, despite a marginal improvement. Delays in investigations, a severe shortage of judges (21 per million), and limited legal aid are key contributors to this persistent issue. Consequently, jails remain critically overcrowded at 121% occupancy, underscoring a deep-seated crisis within the justice system.

title: HC relief for family: Officer in coma since 2023; tax dept told to clear dues
description: Rajasthan HC ordered the commercial taxes department to release the full salary and arrears of officer Surendra Singh Chawra within seven days. Chawra has been in a coma since August 2023, and his salary was stopped after a year. The court cited his family's distress and medical expenses, mandating payment before Diwali.

title: Durga Puja is over, but Bengal colleges yet to complete undergraduate admissions
description: The State Government will be finally closing the centralised admission portal on October 10, and it has asked colleges to individually fill up vacant seats after that date and complete the whole process by November 7.

title: Bihar elections: Pre-poll schemes put youth, women in focus; new policies unveiled
description: PM Modi will inaugurate Jan Nayak Karpoori Thakur Skill University, signaling a strategic outreach to backward communities in poll-bound Bihar. This anchors a series of over Rs 62,000 crore youth empowerment initiatives, including revamped schemes for graduate allowances, women's self-employment, student credit cards, and new bodies like Bihar Yuva Aayog, alongside upgrades to educational institutions.

title: Arthur Jones cause of death: How did the Ravens’ Super Bowl champion die at 39
description: Former NFL star and Super Bowl champion Arthur Jones died suddenly at 39, with his cause of death unconfirmed. A key defensive player in the Baltimore Ravens' Super Bowl XLVII victory, his passing deeply saddened the sports world. Jones, from a renowned athletic family, is remembered for his positive spirit and legacy.

title: Prime Minister Dhan-Dhaanya Krishi Yojana: Govt identifies 100 Aspirational Agriculture Districts, UP tops list
Anil Ambani loan fraud plea: Bombay HC dismisses petition; SBI action stands
description: Bombay High Court on Friday dismissed Anil Ambani's petition challenging SBI's decision to classify Reliance Communications' loan account as "fraud." Ambani argued natural justice was flouted and SBI's action was arbitrary, denying him a personal hearing. The court found no merit in his plea, allowing Ambani to potentially approach the Supreme Court.

title: 'Stop bombing Gaza': Trump to Israel as Hamas agrees to free hostages; urges peace
description: US President Donald Trump reacted to Hamas's announcement to release all Israeli hostages, stating the group seemed ready for "lasting peace." He urged Israel to halt Gaza bombing for safe release, following his ultimatum to Hamas for a peace deal by Sunday evening. Hamas agreed to his proposal, ready for talks on Trump's 20-point peace plan.

title: Buy khadi worth Rs 5,000 every year to push nation towards ‘atmanirbharta’: Shah
Horoscope Today for 4 October, 2025: Key Astrological Trends Affecting Gemini, Capricorn, Libra, Leo, and Other Zodiac Signs
Horoscope Today for October 4, 2025: Key Astrological Trends Affecting Gemini, Capricorn, Libra, Leo, and Other Zodiac Signs
Guru Tegh Bahadur’s Martyrdom: Punjab proposes special House session at Anandpur Sahib
Cyclone Shakti: Season’s 1st storm over Arabian Sea; currently near Gujarat’s Dwarka
description: The season's first cyclonic storm, 'Cyclone Shakti,' has intensified in the Arabian Sea, currently west-southwest of Gujarat. While it will strengthen into a severe cyclonic storm, it is not expected to significantly impact the Indian landmass, though rough sea conditions will persist. Fishermen are advised to avoid venturing into the sea.

title: Cong MP flags ‘missing’ OBC quota in ICAR recruitment, writes to PM
Mumbai: ‘Rapist-killer’ strikes again, victim a 7-yr-old; accused in custody
description: A 32-year-old powerloom worker, who escaped custody two months ago after a 2023 rape-murder, struck again in Bhiwandi. He allegedly raped and strangled a seven-year-old neighbour, leaving her body in a sack. Caught fleeing to Bihar, he faces police custody. The incident raises questions about his prior escape and landlord accountability. Police are investigating further crimes.

title: Beginning 2026, no more ‘tareekh pe tareekh’, FIRs will be disposed of in three years: Amit Shah
Super Bowl champion Arthur Jones dies at 39, NFL fans mourn Ravens star
description: Former NFL defensive lineman Arthur Jones III has tragically passed away at 39, the Baltimore Ravens announced on October 3, 2025. A Super Bowl XLVII champion with the Ravens, Jones also played for the Colts and Washington. His sudden death, with an undisclosed cause, has deeply shocked the sports world.

title: Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs sentenced: Breaks down in court; apologises to family
description: Sean “Diddy” Combs was sentenced to over four years in prison for prostitution charges, though acquitted of more serious sex-trafficking. Judge Arun Subramanian condemned his abuse, citing his power and resources. Diddy broke down in court, apologizing to his family and Cassie Ventura, attributing his “disgusting” actions to drug use and expressing deep remorse.

title: Delhi Confidential: Shifting gears
‘Nice person’ asked my daughter during online game to send nude photos: Akshay
description: Akshay Kumar recounted his 13-year-old daughter Nitara's online sexual harassment experience, where a gamer built trust before demanding nude pictures. Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis emphasized reporting cybercrime within the Golden Hour and launched awareness resources. He also highlighted the growing threat of deepfakes and AI-driven fraud, urging enhanced capabilities to counter them.

title: FASTag rules eased: Non-functional tags pay 1.25x; toll firms held accountable
description: Starting November 15, commuters without a valid FASTag will pay 1.25 times the regular toll via UPI, a significant reduction from the current double charge. Furthermore, if electronic toll infrastructure malfunctions, vehicles with functional FASTags can cross without payment. These new measures aim to hold toll collection agencies accountable, ensuring high-quality systems and providing much-needed relief to motorists nationwide.

title: NCERT's 'Swadeshi' move: Links past to PM Modi’s vision; pushes self-reliance
description: NCERT has launched classroom modules on ‘swadeshi’, tracing its roots from the 1905 anti-partition agitation to PM Modi’s call for a self-reliant India. These modules connect historical boycotts and Indian alternatives with current initiatives like ‘Make-in-India’ and ‘Atmanirbhar Bharat’. They emphasize modern ‘swadeshi’ as a framework for economic leadership, integrating research-driven innovation and AI.

title: Judge sentences Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs to 4 years and 2 months in prison, citing history of abusing women
Hamas says ready to free hostages; Trump urges Israel to halt bombing
description: Hamas said that it accepts some elements of Trump’s peace plan, but others require further negotiation; Hamas official added that group will not disarm before the Israeli occupation ends

title: Gaza peace plan: Hamas agrees to free all Israeli hostages; nods for negotiations
description: Hamas announced its agreement to release all Israeli hostages, alive or deceased, under US President Donald Trump’s Gaza proposal, following his ultimatum. Trump warned of "unprecedented consequences" if a peace deal wasn't reached by Sunday evening, promoting his 20-point plan for Middle East peace, which he claimed had broad regional support.

title: Trump orders Israel to stop bombing Gaza after Hamas partially accepts his peace plan
Bahraich violence case: NSA slapped on 8 jailed accused; extended detention ordered
Republican, Democrat votes to end US Government shutdown fail in Senate
Bombay HC sacks two judges: Serious misconduct cited; graft probe ordered
description: Bombay HC dismissed judges Dhananjay Nikam and Irfan Shaikh for serious misconduct. Nikam faced dismissal after allegedly demanding a Rs 5 lakh bribe for bail, with the HC denying his anticipatory bail due to incriminating evidence. Shaikh was dismissed following a 2022 road accident, though he denies the allegations and plans to challenge the decision.

title: IAEA discussing proposals with Russia, Ukraine to restore power to Zaporizhzhia plant, Grossi says
Husband cannot claim exclusive ownership of jointly purchased property: Delhi HC
V.K. Malhotra built BJP’s base in the Capital: CM
Lakers vs Suns Preseason Game 1: Full injury report for October 3, 2025
description: Robert Griffin III and his family miraculously survived a terrifying car accident in Fort Worth, Texas, where their van spun and hit barriers, but everyone escaped uninjured. Griffin expressed immense relief and gratitude online following the incident. He is now preparing to commentate a Big 12 game in his home state, transitioning from a star player to a sports analyst.

title: RSS did not take prior permission from JNU for holding march: SFI
AAP, BJP trade blame over city’s hospital crisis
New Kendriya Vidyalaya to come up in Khazoori Khas: CM
Search for land for new district court building: Team of Gujarat HC judges visits poultry farm in Surat
Tariff war: Will up India imports, address trade imbalance, says Putin; slams US
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin announced plans to increase imports from India. This aims to balance trade between the two nations. He expressed confidence India will continue energy imports despite US pressure. Putin praised Prime Minister Narendra Modi's leadership. He looks forward to his December visit to India. The two countries marked 25 years of partnership.

title: Three drown in sea in Sindhudurg district of Maharashtra; four missing
description: The victims hail from Belgavi in Karnataka and Kudal in Maharashtra

title: Karur tragedy: High court raps Vijay for fleeing stampede; orders SIT probe
description: Madras High Court ordered an SIT probe against actor-politician Vijay and his TVK for a stampede that killed 41 in Karur and abandoning cadres. The court also mandated a hit-and-run case against Vijay for two vehicle accidents, condemning his party's irresponsible attitude and prohibiting highway rallies until SOPs are formed.

title: File complaints against lax officials over stubble burning: CAQM to district officials
description: New directive aims at strengthening fight against air pollution, empowers top district head across Punjab, Haryana, Rajasthan, U.P., and Delhi to directly move courts against erring officials

title: Government shutdown: The latest five developments from Washington
Transport employees’ union urges Minister to solve pending promotion issues
CPI(M) condemns police assault and detention of protesters in Ariyalur

Vijayawada Utsav a cover for TDP’s loot, alleges  YSRCP leader
description: TDP leaders had collected somewhere between ₹70 crore and ₹100 crore from businesses, hotels, hospitals, and real estate firms in the name of Vijayawada Utsav, alleges Devineni Avinash

title: GVMC clears trees uprooted in gale on war-footing
description: Clearance works have been completed in 62 locations by Thursday night, says GVMC Commissioner, adding that the works are on at the remaining 18 spots

title: Water Metro to commence services to Mattancherry from mid-October
description: ‘Up to three ferries can berth at the floating pontoons at Mattancherry at a time, with one allowed to remain overnight, making it one of the biggest terminals’; ferries to run every 20 to 30 minutes

title: Absconding accused held in multi-level marketing fraud
Cueing up for heyball: the tabletop sport growing in popularity
description: The fast-paced game — also known as Chinese 8-ball — appeals to both pool enthusiasts and cue-sport traditionalists. Indian players, adept at snooker and billiards, find the transition relatively easy. The accessible career path and lucrative rewards make it a compelling option

title: BIE releases tentative timetable for Intermediate Public Exams- 2026
description: Intermediate first-year students will write their exams from February 23 to March 24, while the final-year students will write their papers from February 24 to March 23

title: APSCHE launches portal to build link between colleges, industries
description: Operating guidelines for the admission process of CETs- 2025, in compliance with the orders of the A.P. High Court, have also been released

title: Calm after chaos: Leh hospital heals Sept 24 victims; bullet wounds still haunt
description: Sonam Norboo Memorial Hospital in Leh experienced unprecedented chaos on September 24 when protests led to bullet injuries, a first for many doctors. Initially treating stone-pelting victims, the hospital quickly shifted to emergency mode for the 70 injured, including four fatalities. Police now guard the premises where some accused are still being treated.

title: Historic first: Church of England names woman archbishop; conservatives push back
description: Dame Sarah Mullally will become the first woman to lead the Church of England. She was named Archbishop of Canterbury-designate. Her confirmation is set for January 2026. Mullally previously served as Bishop of London and chief nursing officer. The appointment received praise from Hindu leaders. However, a conservative Anglican group expressed opposition to her leadership.

title: IIT-M launches employment training for diploma students
‘Accurate classification of cancer helps choose right combination of vaccines’
description: Christian Ottensmeier, Director of Clinical Research, The Clatterbridge Cancer Center, delivered the ‘Dr. S. Krishnamurthi Memorial Oration’ recently

title: Woman, her daughter found dead at staff quarters of hospital in Karnataka’s Shivamogga
Amid Piastri-Norris power struggle, Verstappen remains the gold standard
description: The McLaren drivers lead the standings in a dominant car. But the reigning four-time champion — in threatening to poke a spanner in the wheels of an intra-team battle, despite piloting an inferior Red Bull — has shown that he is the standout driver of the season

title: GCC launches upgraded portal, app for pet licensing; microchipping to begin on Oct. 8
description: Around 13,000 pet licences have been issued since August 2023, says senior official; decision on imposing penalties for unlicensed dogs is yet to be taken; city has reported over one lakh dog bite cases from January 2024 till March 2025; six GCC-run clinics set to begin microchipping next week

title: Chennai Metro Rail Limited begins work to install more CCTV cameras at stations
description: According to officials, there were delays in floating tenders as the cost estimation for the project had to be revised

GST cuts: Navratri sales hit 10-year high; retailers report 25-100% sales growth
description: GST reduction on 375 items boosted consumer spending. Navratri sales reached a decade high. Government officials cited industry data. Families upgraded vehicles and bought white goods. This turned festive cheer into record consumption. Brands and retailers reported sales growth. This provided a boost for India's consumption-driven economy. Car bookings also saw an increase.

title: Letters to The Editor — October 4, 2025
BJD accuses BJP government of complicity in recruitment scam in Odisha
description: The regional party demanded a CBI inquiry into the job scam which it alleged was murkier than Vyapam scam of Madhya Pradesh

title: India’s young hearts at risk: Why the 30s have become the new danger zone
description: Heart disease is now alarmingly affecting young Indians in their 20s, 30s, and early 40s, a significant shift confirmed by recent studies. Data shows an average patient age of 38, often with co-existing conditions and sedentary lifestyles. This crisis is fueled by poor lifestyle choices, emphasizing an urgent need for preventive measures and awareness to protect young hearts.

description: Domestic firms show more faith in India than foreign investors

title: Karur stampede: Court dismisses anticipatory bail pleas of TVK leaders ‘Bussy’ Anand, Nirmal Kumar
description: Justice M. Jothiraman dismissed the pleas, taking into consideration the gravity of the incident, and that the probe was at a preliminary stage, and the injured were still in hospital.
